page.title: 08A DAY IN THE LIFE OF- 1
page.content: A long established resident{Mrs. {Wheildon,living in Butlers Marston writes about her typical day. "My husband rises early at 6 a.m. and milks our house-cow,feeds the calves,sheep and a few "bottled lambs" and proceeds to his part-time postmans job at the "Pillertons",returning at lunch time for further work on the small farm or doing gardening or shepherding for neighbours.I get up at 7 a.m.and exercise our five small terriers,then go by bicycle to Kineton High School,where I am part-time assistant librarian,and work three hours daily there.I return home in the afternoon and cook our main meal for 6 p.m.,exercise the terriers again,do gardening or knitting and read a lot.My son and his family live in Butlers Marston and they visit us at weekends when they help on the farm."
